title: NUnit3's nunit2-compatible XML is different for [Explicit] tests

milestone.title: Closed Without Action
milestone.description: This milestone contains closed issues where no action was taken. This includes questions, issues that could not be reproduced, rejected ideas, invalid issues, etc.

body:
Using the following test case:

```
using NUnit.Framework;

namespace NUnitSkippedTests
{
    class Program
    {
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {
        }
    }

    [TestFixture]
    public class MyTest
    {
        [Explicit, Test]
        public void Expl()
        {
        }

        [Ignore("abc"), Test]
        public void Igno()
        {
        }
    }
}
```

When compiled against NUnit2 and run with NUnit2's `nunit-console`, the XML output resembles the following:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" standalone="no"?>
<!--This file represents the results of running a test suite-->
<test-results name="C:\temp\NUnitSkippedTests\NUnitSkippedTests\bin\Debug\NUnitSkippedTests.exe" total="0" errors="0" failures="0" not-run="1" inconclusive="0" ignored="1" skipped="0" invalid="0" date="2016-01-12" time="11:56:02">
  <environment nunit-version="2.6.4.14350" clr-version="4.0.30319.42000" os-version="Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0" platform="Win32NT" cwd="C:\Temp\nunit3" machine-name="REDACTED" user="REDACTED" user-domain="REDACTED" />
  <culture-info current-culture="en-AU" current-uiculture="en-US" />
  <test-suite type="Assembly" name="C:\temp\NUnitSkippedTests\NUnitSkippedTests\bin\Debug\NUnitSkippedTests.exe" executed="True" result="Inconclusive" success="False" time="0.016" asserts="0">
    <results>
      <test-suite type="Namespace" name="NUnitSkippedTests" executed="True" result="Inconclusive" success="False" time="0.008" asserts="0">
        <results>
          <test-suite type="TestFixture" name="MyTest" executed="True" result="Inconclusive" success="False" time="0.007" asserts="0">
            <results>
              <test-case name="NUnitSkippedTests.MyTest.Igno" executed="False" result="Ignored">
                <reason>
                  <message><![CDATA[]]></message>
                </reason>
              </test-case>
            </results>
          </test-suite>
        </results>
      </test-suite>
    </results>
  </test-suite>
</test-results>
```

Note that the test marked with `[Explicit]` does not appear in the output at all, only the test marked with `[Ignore`].

When compiled against NUnit 3 and run with NUnit 3's `nunit-3-console` with as follows:

```
"C:\Program Files (x86)\NUnit.org\nunit-console\nunit3-console.exe" C:\temp\NUnitSkippedTests\NUnitSkippedTests\bin\Debug\NUnitSkippedTests.exe --inprocess --result=skipped3.xml;format=nunit2
```

The XML output resembles the following:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" standalone="no"?>
<!--This file represents the results of running a test suite-->
<test-results name="" total="2" errors="0" failures="0" not-run="2" inconclusive="0" ignored="1" skipped="1" invalid="0" date="2016-01-12" time="00:57:57">
  <environment nunit-version="1.0.0.0" clr-version="4.0.30319.42000" os-version="Microsoft Windows NT 10.0.10240.0" platform="Win32NT" cwd="C:\Temp\nunit3" machine-name="REDACTED" user="REDACTED" user-domain="REDACTED" />
  <culture-info current-culture="en-AU" current-uiculture="en-US" />
  <test-suite type="Assembly" name="NUnitSkippedTests.exe" executed="False" result="Ignored">
    <properties>
      <property name="_PID" value="64936" />
      <property name="_APPDOMAIN" value="test-domain-" />
    </properties>
    <reason>
      <message><![CDATA[One or more child tests were ignored]]></message>
    </reason>
    <results>
      <test-suite type="TestSuite" name="NUnitSkippedTests" executed="False" result="Ignored">
        <reason>
          <message><![CDATA[One or more child tests were ignored]]></message>
        </reason>
        <results>
          <test-suite type="TestFixture" name="MyTest" executed="False" result="Ignored">
            <reason>
              <message><![CDATA[One or more child tests were ignored]]></message>
            </reason>
            <results>
              <test-case name="NUnitSkippedTests.MyTest.Expl" executed="False" result="Skipped">
                <properties>
                  <property name="_SKIPREASON" value="" />
                </properties>
                <reason>
                  <message><![CDATA[]]></message>
                </reason>
              </test-case>
              <test-case name="NUnitSkippedTests.MyTest.Igno" executed="False" result="Ignored">
                <properties>
                  <property name="_SKIPREASON" value="abc" />
                </properties>
                <reason>
                  <message><![CDATA[abc]]></message>
                </reason>
              </test-case>
            </results>
          </test-suite>
        </results>
      </test-suite>
    </results>
  </test-suite>
</test-results>
```

There are three deviations here which do not remain 100% compatible with Nunit 2:
1. The `[Explciit]` test now appears
2. The `[Explicit]` test is given a `result` of `Ignored`, whereas the `[Ignore]`'d test is given a result of `Skipped`.
3. The `Skipped` value seem to be new to NUnit 3 - my code for handling NUnit 2 output never saw this value on NUnit 2.
